title: What Bird Brains Can Teach Self-Driving Cars, U.S. Colleges Trade War Worry, Hilton CEO Christopher Nassetta
itunes:title: What Bird Brains Can Teach Self-Driving Cars, U.S. Colleges Trade War Worry, Hilton CEO Christopher Nassetta
description:
Businessweek Editor Joel Weber and Bloomberg News Venture Capital Reporter Sarah McBride explain how neuroscientists who study birds, mice, and fish are landing seven-figure salaries to help advance artificial intelligence, self-driving cars, and more. Janet Lorin, Bloomberg News Endowments Reporter, discusses why colleges are concerned that a trade war will stem the flow of Chinese studentsto U.S. Hilton CEO Christopher Nassetta says he is not seeing a dramatic impact on the company's business from the geopolitical tensions between the U.S. and China. Nicole Anasenes, CFO & COO at Squarespace, talks about building businesses online. And we Drive to the Close with Dan Griffith, Senior VP at Huntington Private Bank. 

 Hosts: Jason Kelly and Taylor Riggs.  Producer: Paul Brennan 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
